marketNews.title: Trump Trade War Escalation Pressures Global Markets
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Saturday (Feb 1) announced that he will begin implementing import tariffs of 25% for Canada and Mexico, and additional import tariffs of 10% on top of existing tariffs for China, effective Tuesday (Feb 4). Trump asserted that these tariffs would not be lifted until the flow of narcotics from these three countries to the US stops. More specifically, Trump set import tariffs on oil products from Mexico at 25% and from Canada at 10%. The import tariff for energy products from Canada was set lower after considering concerns from oil refineries in the US and Midwestern states. Trump also indicated that additional oil and gas tariffs would occur in mid-February 2025, without providing further details. Previously, on Thursday (Jan 30), Trump mentioned that his administration had not yet determined whether the planned import tariffs would cover oil and gas commodities. On the other hand, the imposition of import tariffs on China occurred about a week after Trump stated that he could make a fair trade deal with China, despite previously considering import tariffs of 10%. In response, Mexico and Canada - the two largest trading partners of the US - pledged to announce retaliatory tariffs soon. Canada retaliated with 25% tariffs on US imports totaling 155 billion US dollars. Meanwhile, China plans to challenge this policy at the World Trade Organization (WTO) and take other "retaliatory measures." Following this news, the USD Index (DXY) strengthened +1.1% to 109.6 in trading today, Monday (Feb 3), while the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar weakened -0.83% to 16,435. The IHSG closed down -1.11% at 7,030, with the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rising +7 bps to 7.06%. On the other hand, oil prices strengthened, with WTI crude oil in the futures market increasing +3.65% to 75.2 US dollars per barrel today. This increase was caused by concerns over potential disruptions to crude oil supply from the two largest suppliers to the US, while weak demand prospects limited this rise. Meanwhile, gold in the spot market briefly recorded an all-time high at 2,817 US dollars per troy ounce on Friday (Jan 31), driven by safe-haven demand due to concerns about global economic growth and inflationary pressures, despite falling -0.09% to 2,796 per troy ounce today. .png)

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Investors need to monitor the developments of this trade war escalation. Trump is reportedly scheduled to speak with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum on Monday (Feb 3) local time. Meanwhile, Trump also stated that tariffs for the European Union will happen later, and he does not rule out imposing tariffs on the UK. To mitigate volatility risks, investors can take the opportunity to lock in government bond yields (FR), such as PBS003 (2-year tenor) which offers a yield of 6.61% per year. Investors can also consider buying quality stocks that are currently correcting, such as Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) and Bank Central Asia ($BBCA). Meanwhile, rising oil and gold prices potentially provide positive sentiment to $ELSA and $MEDC (oil) as well as $BRMS and $HRTA (gold). *This article was previously released on Monday (Feb 3) morning on Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.9 in January 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing Indonesia rose to level 51.9 in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 51.2), marking the growth of factory activity for 2 consecutive months and marking the strongest pace since May 2024. This result was supported by output increasing for 3 consecutive months and marking the strongest increase since May 2024. Furthermore, new orders continued to grow amidst rising foreign orders for 2 consecutive months. In addition, companies increased their purchasing activities ahead of the fasting month, with employment rising to the highest level in 2.5 years. Sentiment also remained positive, supported by expectations of increased output as well as stable demand and economic conditions.

marketNews.title: US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) inflation reached 0.3% MoM in December 2024
marketNews.content: Inflation index of personal consumption expenditures (PCE) in the US reached 0.3% MoM in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 0.1% MoM inflation), meeting consensus expectations and marking the highest level since April 2024. Annually, PCE inflation reached 2.6% YoY (vs. November 2024: 2.4% YoY inflation), marking the highest level in the last 7 months. Core PCE inflation - which is the Fed's indicator for long-term inflation - reached 0.2% MoM in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 0.1% MoM inflation), meeting consensus expectations. Annually, core PCE inflation reached 2.8% YoY (vs. November 2024: 2.8% YoY inflation), still higher than the Fed's target of 2%.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that China's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) slowed to 50.1 in January 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing China slowed to level 50.1 in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 50.5), lower than the consensus expectation of 50.5. This result marked the expansion of factory activity for 4 consecutive months, although it was the slowest pace during that period as foreign orders shrank for 2 consecutive months due to increasing global trade challenges. Employment saw its sharpest decline since February 2024, with selling prices falling at the fastest pace since July 2023. Sentiment improved following expectations of increased business development efforts and supportive government policies, although the level of business optimism remained below average due to concerns about import tariff threats from the US.

marketNews.title: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Friday (Jan 31) that the government does not plan to implement early retirement for coal-fired power plants (PLTU) in 2040
marketNews.content: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Friday (Jan 31) that the government does not plan to implement early retirement for coal-fired power plants (PLTU) in 2040. Hashim made this statement to respond to public misunderstanding regarding the early retirement plan for PLTU in the next 15 years previously conveyed by President Prabowo. Hashim explained that what President Prabowo meant was that the government will not build new PLTU after 2040.

marketNews.title: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Friday (Jan 31) that the government plans to build nuclear power plants (PLTN) with a capacity of 4.3 GW
marketNews.content: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Friday (Jan 31) that the government plans to build nuclear power plants (PLTN) with a capacity of 4.3 GW, although he did not elaborate further. Indonesia's current installed electricity capacity is over 90 GW, with more than half using coal and less than 15% using new and renewable energy.

marketNews.title: BPS noted that Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia slowed to 0.76% YoY in January 2025
marketNews.content: BPS noted that inflation index of consumer price (IHK) in Indonesia slowed to level 0.76% YoY in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 1.57% YoY inflation), below the consensus expectation which predicted inflation at the level of 1.88%. Monthly, Indonesia recorded deflation of 0.76% MoM (vs. December 2024: 0.44% MoM inflation), outside the consensus expectation which predicted 0.32% MoM inflation. The monthly deflation in January 2025 was driven by the electricity tariff commodity which contributed to deflation of 1.47 percentage point following the provision of electricity tariff discounts for customers up to 2,200 VA. Core inflation in January 2025 reached 2.36% YoY (vs. December 2024: 2.26% YoY inflation), higher than the consensus expectation of 2.3% YoY.

marketNews.title: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Friday (Jan 31) that the Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) program worth 20 billion US dollars showed no significant progress after two years
marketNews.content: Special Envoy for Climate and Energy and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Friday (Jan 31) that the Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) program worth 20 billion US dollars showed no significant progress after running for 2 years. Hashim claimed that the JETP program completely failed because not a single dollar was disbursed by the US government. Responding to this, Executive Director of the Institute for Essential Services Reform, Fabby Tumiwa, said that Hashim's claim is inaccurate, mistaken, and not based on data. Fabby stated that JETP funding is not in the form of direct cash assistance, but is channeled through various schemes such as grants, technical assistance, equity, as well as bilateral and multilateral financing. Fabby said that donor countries belonging to the International Partners Group have disbursed 230 million US dollars up to December 2024 in the form of grants and technical assistance for 44 programs. In addition, 1 billion US dollars has been allocated for equity investment and loans for 8 projects, including the funding for the Ijen Geothermal Power Plant of 126 million US dollars from the International Development Finance Corporation.

marketNews.title: Advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Friday (Jan 31) that the additional budget of 100 trillion rupiah for the free lunch program will add almost 2 percentage points to Indonesia's economic growth
marketNews.content: Advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Friday (Jan 31) that the additional budget of 100 trillion rupiah for the free lunch program will add almost 2 percentage points to Indonesia's economic growth. Hashim mentioned that this additional budget will come from the efficiency of the 2025 State Budget (APBN) of 306.7 trillion rupiah, which was instructed by President Prabowo in January 2025. On Thursday (Jan 30), the Ministry of Finance stated that the additional 171 trillion rupiah budget for the free lunch program would cover about 40 million people in 2025. This figure is lower than the claim made by the Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, two weeks ago, who stated that 171 trillion rupiah would allow the free nutritious meal program to reach almost 83 million people in 2025. In the 2025 State Budget itself, the government allocated a budget of 71 trillion rupiah for free nutritious meals, targeting 17.5 million recipients.

marketNews.title: BPS noted that foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia reached 1.24 million in December 2024
marketNews.content: BPS noted that visits by foreign tourists (wisman) to Indonesia reached 1.24 million in December 2024 (+13.8% MoM, +8.7% YoY). This result caused foreign tourist visits to Indonesia throughout 2024 to increase +19.1% YoY to approximately 13.9 million, equivalent to 99.3% of the government's 2024 target of 14 million and marking the highest level since the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 3 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 3 trillion rupiah. The share buyback is expected to take place from March 12, 2025, to March 11, 2026, and the company will seek approval from shareholders at the GMS on March 11, 2025. This corporate action will be executed at a price deemed reasonable by the company, paying attention to POJK No. 29/2023. The treasury shares from the buyback are intended for the employee and/or director and board of commissioner stock ownership program.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Recorded Gold Production Volume of 8.8 koz in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang recorded a gold production volume of 8.8 koz (-10.2% QoQ, -9.0% YoY) in 4Q24. Meanwhile, ferronickel and nickel ore production in 4Q24 reached 4,858 TNi (-4.3% QoQ, -14.6% YoY) and 2.6 million wmt (-15.6% QoQ, -5.1% YoY), respectively. Throughout 2024, ANTM recorded gold production of 32.8 koz (-15.6% YoY), ferronickel of 20,103 TNi (-6.4% YoY), and nickel ore of 9.9 million wmt (-26.1% YoY). Gold sales during 2024 rose to 1.41 million troy ounces (+67.5% YoY), marking an all-time high. Meanwhile, ferronickel and nickel ore sales during 2024 were recorded at 19,452 TNi (-3.4% YoY) and 8.4 million wmt (-28.7% YoY), respectively.

tickerNews.title: Bank OCBC NISP Recorded Net Profit of IDR 1 Trillion in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: $NISP: Bank OCBC NISP recorded a net profit of 1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+1% YoY, -27% QoQ), bringing the net profit for 2024 to 4.9 trillion rupiah (+19% YoY). This performance was driven by Net Interest Income (NII) which grew to 2.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+16% YoY, +2.5% QoQ), so that NII throughout 2024 reached 11 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY). The Net Interest Margin remained unchanged at 4.4% in 4Q24 and 2024. NISP still recorded a reversal of provision expenses, although it decreased to 9 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23 provision expense reversal: 261 billion rupiah), as Gross NPL was maintained at 1.6% (vs. 4Q23: 1.6%, 3Q24: 1.8%). Furthermore, NISP recorded non-operational expenses of 268 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23 non-operational income: 8 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 382 billion rupiah). Throughout 2024, NISP recorded non-operational income of 284 billion rupiah (vs. 2023: 16 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: PGAS Targets an Additional 200,000 Household Gas Connections This Year
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: The President Director of Perusahaan Gas Negara, Arief S. Handoko, said that his party targets an addition of 200,000 household gas network connections in 2025, bringing the total household gas network to over 1 million connections. As of the end of 2024, PGAS's gas network has been connected to over 815,000 households with a pipeline length reaching 20,000 km. PGAS itself will allocate capex of 338 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 361 million US dollars), with 67% of it for natural gas infrastructure construction and 33% for development in the upstream segment.

tickerNews.title: MYOR Prepares IDR 1 Trillion Capex to Support 2025 Growth Target
tickerNews.content: $MYOR: Mayora Indah informed Kontan that the company allocates capex of 1 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 2 trillion rupiah). This fund is intended to strengthen the packaged foods and packaged beverages segments, which are expected to drive expansion and increase production capacity. MYOR management is optimistic that the 4Q24 performance will meet targets. Meanwhile, the main challenge in 2025 still relates to fluctuations in commodity prices, which potentially affect profit margins. On the other hand, MYOR is preparing to launch several new products expected to strengthen their market position, although further details cannot yet be disclosed.

tickerNews.title: MBMA: Two HPAL Projects to Operate in 2025 with Total Capacity of 55,000 Tons of MHP Nickel Annually
tickerNews.content: $MBMA: GM Corporate Communications Merdeka Copper Gold ($MDKA), Tom Malik, said that 2 HPAL projects owned by Merdeka Battery Materials will operate in 2025. Both HPAL plants have a total production capacity reaching 55,000 tons of MHP nickel per year. The first HPAL plant has a production capacity of 30,000 MHP nickel per year and is being worked on by MBMA together with GEM Co. Ltd. through PT ESG New Energy Material, where MBMA holds a 60% stake in the joint venture. Additionally, MBMA also holds a 12.5% stake in PT Meiming New Energy Material which already has an HPAL smelter with a capacity of 25,000 tons per year and is currently in the commissioning stage.

tickerNews.title: PYFA Signs Credit Facility Agreement of up to IDR 120 Billion from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) for Refinancing
tickerNews.content: $PYFA: Pyridam Farma, through its subsidiary, PT Ethica Industri Farmasi, signed a credit facility agreement of up to 120 billion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), intended for the refinancing of existing assets in the form of land and factory buildings. The credit facility has an interest rate of 8.25% per year with a tenure of 96 months from the date of signing the credit agreement.

tickerNews.title: ENAK Announces Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd. as New Controller Following Successful Tender Offer
tickerNews.content: $ENAK: Champ Resto Indonesia announced Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd. as the new controller of the company. The change in control occurred after Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd. completed a voluntary tender offer for ~165.5 million (7.64%) ENAK shares at a price of 1,025 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. After the completion of the voluntary tender offer, Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd. held ~1.1 billion (50.1%) ENAK shares.

tickerNews.title: GLVA Shareholder Sells 17 Million Shares, Reducing Stake to 57.82%
tickerNews.content: $GLVA: Galva Technologies shareholder, PT Elsiscom Prima Karya, sold 17 million GLVA shares at an average price of 308 rupiah per share on January 31, 2025. The total transaction value reached 5.23 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Elsiscom Prima Karya's ownership in GLVA decreased from 58.95% to 57.82%.
